Introduction to Python Programming

Python, created by Guido van Rossum in 1991, has become one of the most popular programming languages globally. Its simplicity and readability make it an excellent choice for beginners.

Why Choose Python?

  • Easy-to-read syntax
  • Extensive library support
  • Large community
  • Versatile applications

Getting Started

To begin your Python journey, you'll need to download Python from the official website. After installation, you can write your first program!

Basic Syntax

print('Hello, World!')
# This is a comment
name = 'John'
age = 25

Variables and Data Types

Python supports various data types:

  • Strings: Text data ('Hello')
  • Integers: Whole numbers (42)
  • Floats: Decimal numbers (3.14)
  • Booleans: True/False
  • Lists: Ordered collections [1,2,3]

Control Structures

# If statement
if age >= 18:
    print('Adult')
else:
    print('Minor')

# For loop
for i in range(5):
    print(i)

Best Practices

  • Use meaningful variable names
  • Follow PEP 8 style guide
  • Comment your code
  • Keep functions small and focused

Next Steps

After mastering these basics, explore:

  • Functions and modules
  • Object-oriented programming
  • File handling
  • Popular libraries like NumPy and Pandas

Remember: Practice is key to learning programming. Try to code daily and work on small projects to reinforce your learning.
